messageBody:
Sorry for a question which I can probably answer myself (rtfm), but are both
JunitEE and Cactus used by implmenting server-side test code?

Are either of the tools (or others) appropriate for pure client-side test
code of server-side objects. The objects I'm concerned with are only EJBs,
no other Servlets, JSP and the like.

Thanks,
Kevin

> -----Original Message-----
> From: kaakaila@... [mailto:kaakaila@...]
> Sent: Thursday, October 11, 2001 2:10 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: how to test session beans
>
>
> hi!
>
> I have made some excercises both with cactus and with junitee at
> http://sourceforge.net/projects/junitee/
>
> As I can see after my short experiences
> Both Cactus and JunitEE can be used to test session beans!
>
> 1)
> +Cactus can test also jsp objects such as request, session etc
> +Cactus seems to have a very strong project working on it.
> -Cactus needs to be installed both on server and client which makes
> it a bit more difficult to use.
> -Cactus testcases are not standard JUnit Testcases
>
> 2)
> +JunitEE is located in the J2EE server and you access it using
> browser
> +JunitEE uses standard JUnit testcases
> -JunitEE cannot test jsp-objects like request, session etc
> -JunitEE is a small project (e.g. me). But it is simple too.
>
> Please correct me if I'm wrong somewhere!
>
> JunitEE project has been very quiet but I like it!
> I like Cactus too and have difficulties in deciding
> what I want to use!
>
> Kaarle Kaila
>

> > > i would like to know, how to test session beans, i mean is
